docs.lead_paragraph: A HALF century ago, when jet travel was not even an aviator's dream, Wiley Post, who piloted his monoplane around the world in eight days, had already discovered what we now call "jet lag." Mr. Post recognized the disruption of...
docs.abstract: Jane E Brody article on 'jet lag,' loss of appetite, lethargy and other biological disorders suffered by airline passengers flying across rapidly changing time zones; offers suggestions on ways to ease impact (L)
docs.snippet: A HALF century ago, when jet travel was not even an aviator's dream, Wiley Post, who piloted his monoplane around  the world in eight days, had already discovered what we now call "jet lag." Mr. Post recognized the disruption of...

docs.lead_paragraph: SOME drugs taken by pregnant women as treatment for serious mental illness might cause permanent changes in the brains of their children, according to scientists whose conclusions are based on new experiments with animals.

headline.main: Some Drugs Found to Alter Fetal Brains; Animal Tests Suggest Good And Bad Effects Some Drugs Found To Alter Fetal Brains Rebound Phenomenon

docs.abstract: Dr Arnold J Friedhoff and colleagues at NYU School of Med rept that some drugs taken by pregnant women as treatment for serious mental illness might cause permanent changes in brains of their children; conclusions based on new experiments with animals, in which chlorpromazine, haloperidol and similar drugs were studied; rept by Friedhoff and Dr Helen Rosengarten appears in Mar 16 issue of Science; illus; diagram (L)
docs.snippet: SOME drugs taken by pregnant women as treatment for serious  mental illness might cause permanent changes in the brains of their children, according to scientists whose conclusions are based on new experiments with animals.
